intro: Glossodia minor var. alba, commonly known as the white glossodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers during the winter months. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from the base of the bulb. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
